intro: Tanulepis decaryi, commonly known as the Decary's tanulepis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide range of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered critically endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
